summary: Before she hits theaters, Carol Danvers will make her triumphant return to comic shops on the pages of Captain Marvel #1, this...
body:
Before she hits theaters, Carol Danvers will make her triumphant return to comic shops on the pages of Captain Marvel #1, this January.  As initially reported by The New York Times, the new series’ creative team will consist of writer Kelly Thompson, artist Carmen Carnero and colorist Tamra Bonvillain.

“I think the character is incredibly important, maybe now more than ever” Thompson said while speaking to the enduring legacy of Captain Marvel.

Captain Marvel will bring it’s titular hero out of the cosmos and back to the skies above New York City.

Check out the interior art as well as the debut cover by Amanda Conner

This slideshow requires JavaScript.

CAPTAIN MARVEL RELAUNCH Before she hits theaters, Carol Danvers will make her triumphant return to comic shops on the pages of Captain Marvel #1, this January.

summary:
In Avengers Age of Ultron, Tony had a vision 
That sadness, that feeling of impotence, that was something we saw again
On Titan,...
body:
Ok let me explain this very clearly

In Avengers Age of Ultron, Tony had a vision

That sadness, that feeling of impotence, that was something we saw again

On Titan, right after he lost everything he had, every friend, so it was only logical to think that Tony was thinking exactly about that vision, about that moment when Steve asked him why he didn’t do more.

But

What

If

We’re

WRONG???

I thought about something else while re-watching the movie for the billionth time:

In the vision Tony also sees the aliens he and the rest of the Avengers fought during the Battle of New York, in the first Avengers movie

One of the most popular fan theory on the internet says that the next Avengers movie will be set exactly during that battle, after a time travel.

WHAT IF…

That vision wasn’t about Avengers: Infinity War but about Avengers 4??? What if the original 6, who are the only ones left alive after the Battle of Wakanda will be exactly the ones to die in Avengers 4? Except Tony, who will live long enough to see his vision come true???

summary: Captain Marvel Soars Into New Marvel Comics Series
title: Captain Marvel Soars Into New Marvel Comics Series
excerpt: Just in time for Brie Larson's theatrical debut as Carol Danvers, Marvel Comics is launching a new Captain Marvel series.
description:
According to The New York Times, the relaunched Captain Marvel brings the hero back to New York City following a stretch in space spent defending against extraterrestrial threats. Carol will reconnect with her best friend, Jessica Drew (aka Spider-Woman), and forge new relationships — including, as Thompson teased, romance.


Sigh, I so badly wish that teased romance would be with a woman, finally revealing Carol to be either gay or bi as fuck like we’ve always hoped for.

But sadly I just can’t help but feel like it’ll obvs be a guy and completely dash our dreams of a gay Carol…

summary: Januárban jön az új Captain Marvel képregény sorozat
title: Januárban jön az új Captain Marvel képregény sorozat
body:
Januárban jön az új Captain Marvel képregény sorozat

Januárban jön az új Captain Marvel képregény sorozat, az író Kelly Thompson (Rogue & Gambit, Mr. & Mrs. X, West Coast Avengers, Hawkeye, Jessica Jones), a rajzoló pedig Carmen Carnero lesz.

“Úgy gondolom, hogy a karakter rendkívül fontos, talán jobban, mint eddig bármikor” – nyilatkozta Thompson.

A kreatív csapat további tagjai: Tamra Bonvillain, Sarah Brunstad és Wil Moss.

View On WordPress

blog.title: You can tell when I'm online

title: New KT news!!!!
body:
“The Boss of Space” returns to Earth in Captain Marvel 1 coming from @Marvel in January by @79SemiFinalist @CarmenCarnero @TBonvillain @MightyBrunstad & @Wil_Moss. I had an excellent conversation with Kelly Thompson about it. Check it out here: https://nyti.ms/2IyCAh8

Captain Marvel, one of the formidable heroines of the Marvel universe, will be getting a hero’s welcome in a new comic-book series that begins in January. The series, which will be written by Kelly Thompson and drawn by Carmen Carnero, returns Captain Marvel to New York City after a stint in space as the first line of defense against alien threats.

The spotlight on the female superhero, and her alter ego Carol Danvers, precedes her debut on the big screen in “Captain Marvel,” starring Brie Larson, which arrives in theaters in March.

“I think the character is incredibly important, maybe now more than ever,” Mrs. Thompson said.

Mrs. Thompson and the rest of the comic’s creative team, which also includes the colorist Tamra Bonvillain and the editors Sarah Brunstad and Wil Moss, will be balancing the expectations of different audiences.

“You really want her to be accessible to new and younger audiences who are going to see the movie, fall in love and want to seek out other Captain Marvel stories,” Mrs. Thompson said. “But you really want to respect the fans who have loved the character for decades. I think there’s a razor’s edge there.”

Congratulations RGA @1979semifinalist​!!!!!
